snippet: As a civil war rages in Syria, the conflict is playing out on a smaller scale in Syrian Druse villages in the Golan Heights, with violence occasionally flaring.
abstract: Buqata Journal; Syria's civil war is playing out on a smaller scale in Syrian Druse villages on the Golan Heights, where divisions are sharpening between those loyal to Pres Bashar al-Assad and an increasingly vocal group of opponents; both sides express a fear that conflict will lead to widespread bloodshed, as families are riven by differing opinions and demonstrations occasionally devolve into violence.

headline.main: Echoes of Syria’s War in the Golan Heights
headline.print_headline: Echoes of Syria’s War In the Golan Heights

snippet: Steve Mann, considered by many to be the world’s first cyborg, sits down to discuss augmented reality, wearable Apple and Google products, and the idea of connecting computers to the brain.

snippet: 4:45 p.m. | Updated  Adding background and details, response from  Google . The rift between  Apple  and Google just got a little wider. On Monday, Apple released a test version of its coming iOS 6 operating system, which powers iPads and iPhones,...
abstract: Apple releases a test version of its coming iOS 6 operating system, minus the YouTube app from its lineup of built-in apps; change is noteworthy because Apple has included the YouTube app with iOS since it released the first iPhone in 2007; disappearance seems to chill any remnants of warmth that once existed between Apple and Google, which owns YouTube. (M)

headline.main: Apple Drops YouTube App In Mobile System Update

byline.original: By NICK WINGFIELD and CLAIRE CAIN MILLER
